intro: Corbularia albicans, commonly known as the white-flowered water plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is native to freshwater habitats in tropical and subtropical regions, including parts of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its slender, ribbon-like leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense underwater mats. Its botanical features make it an important species for aquatic ecosystems and water quality assessment.
